definition.name: NXsts
definition.doc:
An application definition to describe Scanning Tunneling Spectroscopy (STS).
The NXsts application definition extends the NXapm and is dedicated for Scanning Tunneling Spectroscopy (STS) technique.

field.name: definition
field.doc: Name of the definition that is used for the application.

field.name: scan_mode
field.doc: The mode between the tip and sample of the tunneling spectroscopy experiment.

group.name: voltage_sensor
group.doc: The sensor information for the voltage device.

group.name: piezo_sensor
group.doc: The sensor information for the piezo device.

group.name: piezo_configuration
group.doc: The piezo configuration information like piezoelectric device calibration and
The positioner information like the position of the tip, PID loop feedback etc.

group.name: z_controller
group.doc: The PID controller information for the z-axis.

field.name: tip_lift
field.doc: If the tip is lifted from the stable point.

field.name: switch_off_delay
field.doc: The switch-off delay of the controller from its stable point.

group.name: bias_spectroscopy_environment
group.doc: To explain bias (sweep measurement) voltage applied to the sample.
Setup and scan data for continuous measurement of bias-voltage on the subject of experiment vs tunneling current from probe.

group.name: reproducibility_indicators
group.doc: The group's concepts hold the link to the related concepts that define the reproducibility of the STM experiment.

field.name: current
field.doc:
The tunneling current between tip and sample after application of bias voltage. link to the target: /ENTRY[entry]/INSTRUMENT[instrument]/current_sensor/current
Note: The group name written inside the square brackets (e.g. entry in ENTRY[entry]) would be the exact instance name of the base class (e.g. NXentry) in the nexus file.
